title: "runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference" on goerli
body:
v2022.08.03

syncing existing goerli node which I left stopped for a while, it gets stuck forever on staged sync loop because of this exception:

```
goerli-erigon-1     | [EROR] [08-29|23:14:15.154] Staged Sync                              err="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference, trace: [stageloop.go:129 panic.go:844 panic.go:220 signal_unix.go:818 decompress.go:363 block_snapshots.go:432 stage_headers.go:1417 stage_headers.go:1195 stage_headers.go:121 default_stages.go:20 sync.go:347 sync.go:255 stageloop.go:163 stageloop.go:84 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
```

Reverting to v2022.08.02, it behaves very strangely, at the first run it simply crashes:

```
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:16:41.077] Starting private RPC server              on=127.0.0.1:9090
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:16:41.077] new subscription to logs established
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:16:41.077] rpc filters: subscribing to Erigon events
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:16:41.078] new subscription to newHeaders established
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:16:41.078] New txs subscriber joined
goerli-erigon-1     | [EROR] [08-29|23:16:47.783] catch panic                              err="runtime error: invalid memory address or nil pointer dereference" stack="[main.go:29 panic.go:838 panic.go:220 signal_unix.go:818 decompress.go:324 decompress.go:405 block_snapshots.go:182 config.go:245 block_snapshots.go:286 config.go:243 backend.go:572 node.go:115 main.go:58 app.go:526 app.go:286 main.go:34 proc.go:250 asm_amd64.s:1571]"
```

and then, when the container gets rebuild, it works perfectly:

```
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:17:01.217] [Snapshots] Fetching torrent files metadata
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:17:01.225] [Snapshots] Stat                         blocks=4500k indices=4500k alloc=1.2GB sys=1.3GB
goerli-erigon-1     | [INFO] [08-29|23:17:01.342] [1/16 Headers] Waiting for headers...    from=7217507
```

nil pointer error fixed by: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/pull/5224
but root cause still not very clear

I think I don't have the evidence from snapshot dir anymore because in meantime I ran only erigon with --downloader.verify and it was able to complete the run.

Having said that, just in case, here are the dir contents right now:

```
total 92453704
```
